description: I love this, it does one thing and does it well. Interface is clear, simple and looks great. Very nice, thank you.
Very good, does what it has to, but I miss a feature to generate random pairs on a press of a button, just like when you start the app
Tiny utility, very useful and thought-out.
This realy cool app because this working on wayland

It's a simple app... which doesn't work.

Manually typing in the color code doesn't update the colors. Clicking the eye-dropper icon does let me pick a color. Trying manually add a color by clicking on the color preview and trying to click 'custom' doesn't work...

The only thing I can do is choose a color from the presets.

The version on the screenshot has indicators to show the colour associated with each code, and it uses black text on a white background for the input fields. That's great, but version that gets installed does not do this, it uses the user-defined colours for the whole application, meaning it can be hard to use when low-contrast colours are picked. Because there is no indicator showing which code represents which colour, it is easy to pick colours which render the app near-unusable.

Apart from that, it's fine.
Neither of the colour pickers work in the 0.0.5 version at least. Clicking on them does absolutely nothing. So the app is text entry only which rather limits it's use.
Sehr gute App, die mir wirklich geholfen hat einen guten, bzw besseren Kontrast für einen Hintergrund zu finden. Danke!
utile pour vérifier rapidement le contraste du texte et du fond
Utile pour deux tâches : récupérer le code d'une couleur et vérifier le contraste entre deux couleurs. Parfaite intégration à Gnome
